results.title: New York
results.creator_credit: Paul McGuiaan, Benita Matofska and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
New York is a vast metropolis and its famous skyline makes it one of the world’s most spectacular cities. New York is also home to a multitude of ethnic groups who have created a mosaic of diverse cultures and enclaves. Ian Wright visits the famous landmarks found in every promotional brochure but also finds some interesting surprises rarely visited by tourists off the beaten track. Activities covered include: budget hotels, yellow taxis and New York clubland, kosher food on the Lower East Side, visits to the Empire State Building, Central Park and the Statue of Liberty, Harlem, the Bronx and Brooklyn, and a helicopter flight over the city.

results.title: Argentina
results.creator_credit: Colin Napthine, Deborah Hinnigan and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Argentina is a land of many contrasts, a land where the magnificent desolation of Patagonia and the Andes contrast dramatically with the urban frenzy of Buenos Aires, one of the world’s largest and most cosmopolitan cities. In this instalment of ‘The Lonely planet’ series, traveller Justine Shapiro visits Iguazu Falls, travels on one of the most spectacular railway journeys in Latin America, spends a day with gauchos, learns to tango, and visits the San Moreno glacier at the tip of Latin America.

results.title: Japan: Tokyo to Taiwan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Ian Wright conducts this Lonely planet tour of Japan, experiencing the bullet train at 160 miles per hour, having his fortune read at a Buddhist shrine, visiting the peace museum in Nagasaki, and soaking up the fantastic environment at the Aso Fire Festival.

results.title: Cuba and Haiti
results.creator_credit: Jenny Dames, Dawn Beresford and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Cuba is the largest and least commercialised country in the Caribbean. Political factors too have kept tourists away since Castro’s revolution in the fifties. Beginning his journey in the famous Cuban capital of Havana, Ian Wright travels across Cuba, skydiving onto a Havana beach, visiting a Cuban cigar factory, swimming with dolphins, visiting the Che Guevara University and watching a voodoo ceremony in Haiti. His journey ends in Haiti, the oldest black republic in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jenny Dames, Dawn Beresford and Pilot Films

results.title: South India
results.creator_credit: Jez Higham, Emma Cahwac and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro explores India’s southern tip, travelling through the state of Tamil Nadu, and then on to tropical Kerala where she tours its famed network of backwaters and canals. Justine ends her journey on the rarely visited Lakshadweep islands in the middle of the Arabian Sea. Other activities covered in the journey include: eating at a vegetarian restaurant where 3,000 customers lunch everyday, riding on a bullock cart to a Hindu temple at Tiravanamali, travelling to an elephant sanctuary and bathing them, and visiting one of India’s few female gurus who has hugged over ten million people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jez Higham, Emma Cahwac and Pilot Films

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Sound in View (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Technology”.
A visual depiction of sound waves including digital and modulated formats. The aim of this program is to teach the meanings of a number of terms used to describe the signals used in telecommunications.
